alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 6:01AM CDT until August 08 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern De Kalb County in north central Illinois... Northern Ogle County in north central Illinois... * Until 1000 AM CDT. * At 601 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has already fallen. The stronger storms will produce rainfall rates of 1 to 1.5 inches in an hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sycamore, Genoa, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Davis Junction, Kirkland, Forreston, Kingston, Stillman Valley, Lindenwood, Monroe Center, Leaf River, Fairdale, Adeline and Baileyville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Stay away from flooded streams, ditches, stream banks, and fields. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
